verses.verse: (Mourning for the Pierced One) (Jer. 31:9; 50:4; Ezek. 39:29; (Joel 2:28, 29)) “And I will pour on the house of David and on the inhabitants of Jerusalem the Spirit of grace and supplication; then they will (John 19:34, 37; 20:27; (Rev. 1:7)) look on Me whom they pierced. Yes, they will mourn for Him (Jer. 6:26; Amos 8:10) as one mourns for his only son, and grieve for Him as one grieves for a firstborn.
In that day there shall be a great ((Matt. 24:30); Acts 2:37; (Rev. 1:7)) mourning in Jerusalem, (2 Kin. 23:29) like the mourning at Hadad Rimmon in the plain of Megiddo.

((Matt. 24:30; Rev. 1:7)) And the land shall mourn, every family by itself: the family of the house of David by itself, and their wives by themselves; the family of the house of (Luke 3:31) Nathan by itself, and their wives by themselves;
the family of the house of Levi by itself, and their wives by themselves; the family of Shimei by itself, and their wives by themselves;
all the families that remain, every family by itself, and their wives by themselves.

(Idolatry Cut Off) “In that (Acts 10:43; (Rev. 21:6, 7)) day (Ps. 36:9; (Heb. 9:14; 1 John 1:7)) a fountain shall be opened for the house of David and for the inhabitants of Jerusalem, for sin and for (Num. 19:17; Is. 4:4; Ezek. 36:25) uncleanness.

“It shall be in that day,” says the LORD of hosts, “that I will (Ex. 23:13; Hos. 2:17) cut off the names of the idols from the land, and they shall no longer be remembered. I will also cause (Jer. 23:14, 15; 2 Pet. 2:1) the prophets and the unclean spirit to depart from the land.

It shall come to pass that if anyone still prophesies, then his father and mother who begot him will say to him, ‘You shall (Deut. 18:20; (Ezek. 14:9)) not live, because you have spoken lies in the name of the LORD.’ And his father and mother who begot him (Deut. 13:6-11; (Matt. 10:37)) shall thrust him through when he prophesies.

“And it shall be in that day that (Jer. 6:15; 8:9; (Mic. 3:6, 7)) every prophet will be ashamed of his vision when he prophesies; they will not wear (2 Kin. 1:8; Is. 20:2; Matt. 3:4) a robe of coarse hair to deceive.
(Amos 7:14) But he will say, ‘I am no prophet, I am a farmer; for a man taught me to keep cattle from my youth.’
And one will say to him, ‘What are these wounds between your arms?’ Then he will answer, ‘Those with which I was wounded in the house of my friends.’

(The Shepherd Savior) “Awake, O sword, against (Is. 40:11; Ezek. 34:23, 24; 37:24; Mic. 5:2, 4) My Shepherd, Against the Man ((John 10:30)) who is My Companion,” Says the LORD of hosts. (Matt. 26:31, 56, 67; Mark 14:27; 1 Pet. 5:4; Rev. 7:16, 17) “Strike the Shepherd, And the sheep will be scattered; Then I will turn My hand against (Luke 12:32) the little ones.
And it shall come to pass in all the land,” Says the LORD, “That (Is. 6:13; Ezek. 5:2, 4, 12) two-thirds in it shall be cut off and die, ((Rom. 11:5)) But one-third shall be left in it:

I will bring the one-third (Is. 48:10; Ezek. 20:38; Mal. 3:3) through the fire, Will (1 Pet. 1:6, 7) refine them as silver is refined, And test them as gold is tested. (Ps. 50:15; Zeph. 3:9; (Zech. 12:10)) They will call on My name, And I will answer them. (Jer. 30:22; Hos. 2:23) I will say, ‘This is My people’; And each one will say, ‘The LORD is my God.’ ”
(The Day of the LORD) Behold, ((Is. 13:6, 9; Joel 2:1; Mal. 4:1)) the day of the LORD is coming, And your spoil will be divided in your midst.

For (Joel 3:2; Zech. 12:2, 3) I will gather all the nations to battle against Jerusalem; The city shall be taken, The houses rifled, And the women ravished. Half of the city shall go into captivity, But the remnant of the people shall not be cut off from the city.
Then the LORD will go forth And fight against those nations, As He fights in the day of battle.

And in that day His feet will stand (Ezek. 11:23; Acts 1:9-12) on the Mount of Olives, Which faces Jerusalem on the east. And the Mount of Olives shall be split in two, From east to west, (Joel 3:12) Making a very large valley; Half of the mountain shall move toward the north And half of it toward the south.

Then you shall flee through My mountain valley, For the mountain valley shall reach to Azal. Yes, you shall flee As you fled from the (Is. 29:6; Amos 1:1) earthquake In the days of Uzziah king of Judah. ((Ps. 96:13); Is. 66:15, 16; Matt. 24:30, 31; 25:31; Jude 14) Thus the LORD my God will come, And (Joel 3:11) all the saints with You.
It shall come to pass in that day That there will be no light; The lights will diminish.
It shall be one day (Matt. 24:36) Which is known to the LORD— Neither day nor night. But at (Is. 30:26) evening time it shall happen That it will be light.
